intro: Diplotheca atropilosula, commonly known as the black-flowered diplotheca, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, dark purple to black flowers arranged in dense clusters, giving it its common name. It has hairy stems and leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. Diplotheca atropilosula is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
